summary: This is a transcript of a September 22, 2021 interview conducted by the DOJ Office of the Inspector General with Mark Epstein, brother of Jeffrey Epstein, regarding the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death. Mark Epstein presents his theory that his brother was murdered in prison, citing autopsy findings, broken neck bones, a non-working camera, and suspicious circumstances. He is accompanied by his attorney, Stacey Richman.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein's brother who is being interviewed by the OIG. He argues that Jeffrey's death was a homicide, not a suicide, based on autopsy evidence and prison irregularities.

persons.name: Stacey Richman
persons.context: Mark Epstein's attorney present during the OIG interview. She clarifies points and provides legal context.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the death investigation. His brother Mark claims he was murdered in prison.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: Identified as the guard who found Jeffrey Epstein's body and claimed to have cut him down.

persons.name: David Shone
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein's attorney who met with him in jail and reportedly said Jeffrey was upbeat about his defense.

connections.description: Mark is Jeffrey Epstein's brother. They spoke every few weeks and emailed but had not seen each other in person for seven years prior to Jeffrey's death.
Stacey Richman is Mark Epstein's attorney, representing him during the OIG interview.
David Shone was Jeffrey Epstein's attorney who met with him in jail and discussed his defense.
David Mitchell was a friend who put up money for Jeffrey Epstein's bail.
Jeffrey Epstein worked with Steve Bannon, who reportedly has 16 hours of video tape interviews with him.
Mark Epstein contacted Steve Bannon after Jeffrey's death to inquire about the video tapes.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive/dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

events.title: Autopsy performed
events.description: Autopsy conducted by the city pathologist with Dr. Baden present. Findings included three broken bones in the neck and ligature marks inconsistent with a soft hanging.

events.title: Body moved from prison
events.description: Epstein's body was moved from the prison to the hospital, which Mark Epstein claims is against protocol for a death scene.

events.title: Death certificate changed to suicide
events.description: The Chief Medical Examiner of New York declared the death a suicide a few days after the autopsy, despite the initial 'pending' cause of death.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's arrest
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested upon returning from Paris.

events.title: OIG interview with Mark Epstein
events.description: The Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General interviews Mark Epstein about his brother's death.

locations: New York Field Office, Office of Inspector General (interview location)
Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) (where Jeffrey Epstein died)
Jeffrey Epstein's house on First Street (mentioned regarding camera system)
keyFacts: Mark Epstein believes his brother Jeffrey was murdered in prison, citing a broken hyoid bone and two other neck bones, which he claims is extremely rare in a soft hanging.
A camera on the tier where Jeffrey Epstein's cell was located was not working at the time of his death, and its failure was not explained.
Mark Epstein states that Jeffrey was dead for at least two hours before being found, based on the ligature groove on his neck.
Mark Epstein had agreed to guarantee Jeffrey Epstein's entire bail (close to $100 million) just days before Jeffrey's death, and a bail hearing was scheduled for two days after he died.
Mark Epstein mentions that Jeffrey Epstein changed his will and put his assets into a trust shortly before his death.
